title: StrongAle
content:

The first thing to do was to create a portfolio. I wanted something that, in addition to showing my most impressive works, could say something more about me, and may express my skills, besides my creativity.
Everything you can see, whether it‚Äôs design, development or content, is the result of my ideas and work. So I‚Äôm the only one to blame üò¨

subtitle: Just the website you are browsing right now.

title: Angry Scientist
content:
Angry Scientist aims to help people counter conspiracy theorists with facts, logic, and brutal humour.
This website is the result of only nine days of my work, coming from three chunks of three days, spread over different months. In addition to development, were also held during these days: meetings, training on content uploading, layout changes, revisions, and website release.
Aware of the limited time available, and to avoid mishaps and delays, I chose to rely on easy solutions in which I was highly confident, and that made it easy for the client to upload content. For this reason, I built a small WordPress theme that benefits from the CMS built-in AJAX features since it is necessary for a real-time content filter by custom fields.
subtitle: ‚ÄúStop arguing with idiots on the internet.‚Äù

title: Sotherga
content:
Sotherga is an aesthetic medicine clinic in Milan. The project had three main integrated parts: A WordPress-based corporate area, a skin care products online store built with OctoberCMS, and an interactive questionnaire to receive a skincare routine consultation.
My roles in the project were: Main core UI, WordPress and survey front-end developer, and senior front-end developer for the store part.
subtitle: ‚ÄúThe art of aesthetic medicine‚Äù

title: FULL
content:
FULL (Future Urban Legacy Lab) is the international interdepartmental research centre of the Politecnico di Torino that investigates the present and the future of cities, on a global and local scale. The website aims to share the centre's research projects, publications, and multimedia content produced during the events.
This project was my first experience as a lead developer.
subtitle: Future Urban Legacy Lab

title: UFOPLAST
content:
UFO Plast was founded in 1977 in Tuscany-Italy and immediately became part of the social imaginary as a true icon of the off-road world.
While all my friends tried to beat the boredom of the first lockdown, binge-watching Netflix shows, home-baking bread and pizza, and gardening, I was working on this e-commerce.
The main challenge for this project was using Prestashop as CMS. The fact that remote working was new to many doubtless contributed to the struggle.
subtitle: ‚ÄúHigh-quality gear just landed on Earth.‚Äù

title: ALD
content:
ALD (Lucchese Diabetic Association) is a non-profit charity that has been active for over thirty years in the Lucca area. Its primary purpose is the development of solidarity between people who, suffering from diabetic pathology, can share, by confronting each other, all the problems created by this pathology.
It‚Äôs a small and simple blog with some institutional information. I designed and developed it in a short time and low budget. However, as a diabetic, I am proud to have contributed to the cause.
subtitle: ‚ÄúAlone we go faster, but together we go further.‚Äù

title: My Tunnel of lo(l/n)eliness
content:
My Tunnel of lo(l/n)eliness is one of my main Art projects during my Net Art and Digital Cultures specialisation.
It's a tunnel-like collection of all my (now abandoned) Tumblr blog posts.
My first experience with Three.js and weird UXs. It also works in VR, and I exhibited it at the annual exhibition of the Academy of Fine Arts of Carrara.
subtitle: The right way to enjoy the web fun!
